item.title: Ticket #9373 (default permalinks (post count issue)) closed
item.dc:creator: mrmist
item.description:
invalid:

#7373 was the same and was closed by a core dev. It's the intended behaviour and you can't rely on these being consecutive any more.

item.title: Ticket #9373 (default permalinks (post count issue)) updated
item.dc:creator: filosofo
item.description:
Those extra ids are probably being used by revisions. You can turn them off by putting the following in wp-config.php:

define('WP_POST_REVISIONS', false);

item.title: Ticket #9374 (Bug in Writing Post or Page) closed
item.dc:creator: filosofo
item.description:
invalid:

Your host has set up mod_security or the like to block the posting of certain keywords. This is not a WordPress issue.

item.title: Ticket #9374 (Bug in Writing Post or Page) created
item.dc:creator: Ronin898
item.description:
I found a bug today while working on a site for The American Border Leicester Association and they have the word curl it caused an error:

"Forbidden

You don't have permission to access /wp-admin/page.php on this server."

I put a non breaking space after curl and there were no problems. The problem went away. I know curl is a command line and perhaps php command so I think that may be the cause. So you know there are no extra plugins activated.

item.title: Ticket #9373 (default permalinks (post count issue)) created
item.dc:creator: norwat
item.description:
I have a problem with the interaction of WordPress and some of my plug-ins (SimpleTags, WP-o-Matic, and Feedpress). It was not a problem before 2.7, and it may affect WordPress independent of my plugins too.

In short, I have permalinks set to default setting (?p=123). If I make any adjustments to the post, such as manage tags with SimpleTags, it ticks off a post ID slot (but it does not generate a new post). For example: if last post is ?p=123, and I modify tags on five existing posts, the next new post will have the id ?p=129.

I do not like long post URLs, and prefer the default permalink setting, but this behavior is annoying and a bother. In short, it very quickly ups the post count without generating any new posts. I have 320 or so posts, but my current post count is 1034. I believe the issue started with WordPress 2.7, and so I am identifying it as a WordPress bug (and not a plug-in bug).

Is it possible to fix this behavior in future updates so that the post count function works exclusively to enumerate new post IDs?

item.title: Ticket #9372 ("Preview" button in edit page button does not work.) updated
item.dc:creator: webstoc
item.description: Addendum: the above workaround only works if the new post has been saved as a draft first, or published.

item.title: Ticket #9372 ("Preview" button in edit page button does not work.) created
item.dc:creator: webstoc
item.description:
I'm running multiple instances of wordpress for a group of customers in a variety of blogs, and they all have been reporting for awhile that the preview button in the edit post section of their blog is broken. I finally took time to chase down the section of the code that's responsible for this.

In wp-admin/js/post.js (line 385 for my version - 2.7.1), there exists the following code block:

$('#post-preview').click(function(e){

if ( 1 > $('#post_ID').val() && autosaveFirst ) {

autosaveDelayPreview = true; autosave(); return false;

}

$('input#wp-preview').val('dopreview'); $('form#post').attr('target', 'wp-preview').submit().attr('target', ); $('input#wp-preview').val(); return false;

});

This jquery code retrieves a hidden field in the form generated by edit-form-advanced.php, populates it, submits the form, and clears the value. It then returns false, which is of course why the button is not working for my users. The question is, why is the form submission not working? The ff error console is unenlightening, but that's not surprising; I've found jQuery does have a tendency to suppress errors.

I've checked what's being returned by the various jquery selectors in that instance, and everything seems on the up and up. I do note that commenting out that block, including the false return value, yields a preview page in a separate tab that works just fine. E.g.:

$('#post-preview').click(function(e){

if ( 1 > $('#post_ID').val() && autosaveFirst ) {

autosaveDelayPreview = true; autosave(); return false;

} /* $('input#wp-preview').val('dopreview'); $('form#post').attr('target', 'wp-preview').submit().attr('target', ); $('input#wp-preview').val(); return false; */

});

Not knowing why this is being done by form rather than by just hyperlink, coupled with the fact that I'd be off the reservation when it came to updates, makes me loathe to make this sort of fix for my users. I didn't see any instance of this particular problem in the trac so far. Can advise?

item.title: Ticket #4065 (useful function: merge_wp_queries()) updated
item.dc:creator: tomgf
item.description:
First step, combining the WHERE clause: 

$q1 = new WP_Query('monthnum=10&year=2008');
$q2 = new WP_Query('monthnum=9&year=2008');
$merged = merge_wp_queries($q1, $q2, 'post_date_gmt', 'desc');
function merge_wp_queries( $q1, $q2, $sortby='post_date_gmt', $sortorder='desc' )
{
 global $wpdb, $merged_where;
 $where_1 = "( YEAR(".$wpdb->posts.".post_date)='".$q1->query_vars['year']."' AND MONTH(".$wpdb->posts.".post_date)='".$q1->query_vars['monthnum']."' )";
 $where_2 = "( YEAR(".$wpdb->posts.".post_date)='".$q2->query_vars['year']."' AND MONTH(".$wpdb->posts.".post_date)='".$q2->query_vars['monthnum']."' )";
 $merged_where = " AND ( $where_1 OR $where_2 )";
 add_filter('posts_where', 'merged_where' );
 return new WP_Query('showposts=10');
}
function merged_where( $where )
{
 global $merged_where;
 return $where . $merged_where;
}

item.title: r10828-excerpt-info-codex-link.diff attached to Ticket #9371
item.dc:creator: demetris
item.description: Changes the info link for Excerpts to a Codex page for end users

item.title: Ticket #9371 (Change excerpt info link to a Codex page for END users) created
item.dc:creator: demetris
item.description:
Currently, the decription in the Excerpt metabox links to a Codex article which is more for developers and tinkerers:

​http://codex.wordpress.org/Template_Tags/the_excerpt

I started a Codex article with information for people who just want to USE the excerpt and learn what it does:

​http://codex.wordpress.org/Excerpt

... and I am submitting a patch to link to that page instead.

Please, feel free to edit the Codex page — or to dismiss the idea of this patch completely, if you don’t agree. :-)

The Codex draft article is a super-condensed summary of an article I recently wrote about the manual Excerpt in WordPress:

​http://op111.net/67

item.title: Ticket #9368 (WP_ADMIN needs to be true in flash uploader) created
item.dc:creator: hailin
item.description:
<mdawaffe_lap_> eagleclaw: wp-admin/async-upload.php loads admin.php after wp-load.php, so WP_ADMIN is not defined by the time plugins are loaded.

It needs to be TRUE because some plugin tests this variable to make sure the URL is a admin one.

item.title: Ticket #9364 (Posting Comments in Front Page results in 404) created
item.dc:creator: spikeyslam
item.description:
This problem occurs when the front page and comment paging are set:

Reading Settings > Front page Discussion Settings > Break comments into pages

Posting a comment on

​http://mysite.com/

redirects to: ​http://mysite.com/comment-page-1/#comment-1

which results in a 404 error.

If permalinks are not enabled, it redirects to the Posts page.

To reproduce:

  1. Add comments_template() to Default theme's page.php or use any theme that supports paged comments with pages
  2. Set the front page to a page
  3. Enable paged comments
  4. Post a comment to the front page

item.title: Ticket #9363 (separate "password" word in translations) created
item.dc:creator: gonahkar
item.description:
we have a problem in our Persian translation of WordPress, Persian language is RTL and when we send registeration emails for users, our translation of "password": "رمز" is mixed with the random generated password, because the combination of rtl characters and Latin (English) numbers can not be shown well in LTR format.

because of this we think if the "password" that is used in emails be separated in translation; like this "Password|used in emails" we can solve this problem by not translating this word in emails.

item.title: Ticket #9362 (Quoting issues....) created
item.dc:creator: Paleo Pat
item.description:
Not sure, if this should be under press this or under TinyMCE, But I'll put in both places to be sure.

What is happening is this.

If you try and quote a single paragraph. It works. But if you quote more than one. Like where they are spaces in between. The quote function does not work. I've tried it in FireFox's latest, and with Google Chrome.

Again to be clear, if you high a single paragraph, it will quote it, no problem. But if you try to quote like 3 paragraphs and try to hit the quote function, it does not work.

This happens in the "Press This Screen" and in the normal "Add Post" window, using the rich editor, the standard editor works fine, but it is a bit annoying for we bloggers who do sometimes quote a few paragraphs of a news story or something.

Thanks,

-Pat Owner PoliticalByline.com

P.S. I am running 2.8 bleeding, and this just started as of last build.

item.title: Ticket #6847 ('the_content_rss' hook not working) updated
item.dc:creator: tadhg
item.description:
westi: You're right about how it should work, but the problem is that apparently the_content_rss hook doesn't always get called--i.e. with Atom or RSS2 feeds. It looks to me like mystyman's patch addresses the problem that's caused by ​http://core.trac.wordpress.org/ticket/8706

I think this bug should be a duplicate of 8706 at this point.

item.title: Ticket #9359 (Add the sticky post grey background from WP.com's Kubrick to core) created
item.dc:creator: Viper007Bond
item.description:
When you sticky a post in Kubrick on WordPress.com, it gets a grey background showing it's sticky.

Demo: ​http://viper007bond.wordpress.com/

I think it's a very handy feature and should be ported to version of Kubrick that's bundled with WordPress.
